metadata.title: Salah and Caldentey Voted Player of the Year by Fellow Pros in English Soccer

left: Mohamed Salah has won a record third Professional Footballers’ Association Men’s Player of the Year award, making history as the first player to achieve this feat.
Arsenal’s Mariona Caldentey won the women’s accolade at the PFA Awards.
Salah expressed pride in his achievement, stating, "I look at myself now, a guy coming from Egypt and making it to the top level, making history today, it’s something that makes me so proud."

Caldentey expressed uncertainty about her position on the pitch, saying, "If you ask me my position I don’t know what to answer, but I just enjoy it on the pitch and I just want to help my team-mates.
center: Mohamed Salah, Liverpool star, has won a record third Professional Footballers' Association Men's Player of the Year award for his stunning form in 2024/25.
Arsenal's Mariona Caldentey, who scored 19 goals last season including 8 in the Champions League final win, was named PFA Women's Player of the Year.
Olivia Smith and Morgan Rogers were named PFA Young Players of the Year for women's and men's football respectively.
right: Mohamed Salah was named the Professional Footballers' Association Player of the Year on Aug 19, becoming the first player to win the award three times.
Salah scored 29 goals and provided 18 assists, helping Liverpool win the league title, finishing 10 points ahead of Arsenal.
He also won the Premier League Player of the Season award, the Golden Boot, and the Playmaker award, making him the first player to win all three in one season.
Liverpool had four players named in the Premier League team of the year, including Salah and Milos Kerkez from Bournemouth.
